name: Alexander Albon
introduction: Alexander Albon Ansusinha, born 23 March 1996, is an Anglo-Thai racing driver, who made his FIA Formula One World Championship debut during the 2019 season for Scuderia Toro Rosso-Honda.[1] The son of former British Touring Car Championship racer Nigel Albon, but racing under a Thai racing license, Albon arrived in F1 after finishing third in the 2018 FIA Formula 2 Championship, despite having already signed a deal to join Nissan e.Dams in Formula E.[2]
